answers.answer: Yes, it could be hormonal.  Ask your doctor to run a thyroid panel to make sure your thyroid is functioning properly.  You need to have TSH, Free T3 and Free T4 tested; don't settle for just TSH, as many doctors will do.  Thyroid malfunction can cause the weight issue, fatigue and menstrual issues.You should also get blood sugar levels tested.  Extreme thirst is a symptom of diabetes.You could also be in beginning stages of peri-menopause, though you're quite young for that.  Still a possibility.Ask for a complete blood work and thorough exam.

question: Hi. I am 34 years old and 5'6. I have always weighed between 108 and 110 lbs, but in the past month my weight has jumped to 120. I exercise regularly and haven't changed my diet. I noticed my abdomen getting bigger and then the weight jumped up. Could this be hormonal? I am exhausted all the time, my menstrualcycle is outOf whack. I knowI'm not pregnant though. I've also been very thirsty and getting headaches. I have even tried cutting back on calories and still can't lose weight.I
title: Unexplained rapid weight gain
